intro: Limonium tibulatium, commonly known as the Tibetan sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet and neighboring areas. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy bracts make it a distinctive species in its habitat. Limonium tibulatium is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
